subject: Re: [junit] junit4 timeout not working
msgSnippet: Hmm.  That s a surprising result to me.  Do you have time to boil it down into a single class I can run on its own?  Thanks, David Saff
messageBody:
Hmm. That's a surprising result to me. Do you have time to boil it
down into a single class I can run on its own? Thanks,

David Saff

On Mon, Jan 17, 2011 at 8:13 PM, pdoranwu <galoif@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am contributing to bluej project which is a java IDE targeted for university students. It is multi threaded environment. Here is a code snippet that we use to invoke a test method:
>
>
> Result res = (new JUnitCore()).run(Request.method(StudentTest.class, methodName));
> if (res.wasSuccessful()) {
>    System.out.println("\tsuccess");
> } else {
>    System.out.println("\tfailure");
> }
>
>
> I have annotated our StudentTest class test methods with:
>    @Test(timeout = 1)
>
> I can see that all the tests run successfully. However, one of the tests run longer than 1mS, but there is no timeout error given in the res variable.
>
> I'm wondering if this is some weird threading issue related to how we have configured our multi threaded environment.
>
> Any suggestions? Let me know if you need any more information.
>
> Regards,
> Patrick
